q: North America president Mark Reuss and Chrysler's Mr. Sergio Marchionne all promise not to fall back into the trap of making too many cars and then slapping huge discounts on the vehicles to move metal off dealer lots. This has been the heart of the problem in Detroit, said Mr. Sergio Marchionne , who also heads up Fiat, the Italian auto company. Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo.

It was incredible- the way they were each buried- individually, according to the word of Islamic tradition: their faces towards the Kaaba( Mekka), the libna( mud brick) under the head, the white shroud- complete to the smallest detail.`` Since when did al Qaida burry its victims observing such details?? No- These were Qaida fighters for sure . SO- I ask: What benefit would security forces gain by distorting this story? Is it to sow more hatred for al Qaida?
